match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 5 wickets (with 8 balls remaining)

series.name: Sri Lanka tour of South Africa
series.longName: Sri Lanka tour of South Africa

match.hoursInfo: 10.00 start, First Session 10.00-13.30, Interval 13.30-14.15, Second Session 14.15-17.45

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal not out 92 (115b 6x4 0x6 179m) SR: 80
Upul Tharanga c †de Villiers b M Morkel 66 (85b 6x4 1x6 125m) SR: 77.64

dismissalComment.html: ah, tragic for SL. Just as he was looking super-ominous, Tharanga is gone. Short of a length and angled across, not too much pace, no sideways movement. Not much room to work with. Tharanga did what he's done efficiently all day - he attempted to make some room and steer with an open-face to third man, but this time he edges it into AB's gloves. Well played, given the circumstances, but he'll hurt on the way back in.

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: oh Sanga. Goner. He's been resolute all morning, but inevitably pokes at one outside off. That was on a length, not there for the drive or the cut, and probably had to be left alone. Sanga had left alone too many already, and chose to nibble at it. Thin edge, dies on AB, who takes it in front.

You thought that Steyn catch was a classic? Petersen says hang on, I have some more entertainment. Kula goes back and looks for another straight loft, but doesn't time it that well. Robin is inside the circle at mid-on, and runs back half the way from East London to London proper, looking back over his right shoulder all the time. He then lunges full length forward towards the ropes and the ball tumbles into his palms as he sprawls. South Africa - setting high fielding standards since 1992, only to raise the bar soon after.

ah, tragic for SL. Just as he was looking super-ominous, Tharanga is gone. Short of a length and angled across, not too much pace, no sideways movement. Not much room to work with. Tharanga did what he's done efficiently all day - he attempted to make some room and steer with an open-face to third man, but this time he edges it into AB's gloves. Well played, given the circumstances, but he'll hurt on the way back in.

holy cow! Is that a plane? is that Jonty Rhodes? No, that's Dale Steyn! Morne angles a length ball into Mahela's pads, and it is there to be helped along to fine leg. Mahela makes very good connection as he moves inside the line and whip-glances. Steyn is inside the circle at short file leg. He moves to his left, takes off and plucks it when he's nearly fully horizontal, with both hands. Shades of McGrath's catch of Vaughan in Adelaide, many years ago, in the age when Australia used to win the Ashes. Who said fast bowlers can't field. Superb take!

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan run out (du Plessis) 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Is Dilshan gone? Third umpire looking at the run-out appeal. Short of a length on off stump, Dilshan goes back and forces it into the cover-point. Faf du Plessis prowls at point, and is a superb fielder. Dilshan saw it was going almost straight at him, and realised he had played it off the back foot, and hesitated midway through the run. Mistake. Faf hurls it down to the non-striker's end, and the ball clips the bail after bouncing short. Dilshan is just out of the crease, and then falls on Morne Morkel who was running in from mid-on. Gone. Another duck. 2/5th of the way into the ODI series, the SL captain is yet to get a run.

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c M Morkel b Steyn 28 (29b 1x4 1x6 47m) SR: 96.55

dismissalComment.html: and a wicket to end the innings. Mathews tries to create room and go over mid-off, but the ball stops on him and he toe-ends to Morne at mid-off. Sri Lanka will want the slowness to continue in the chase - this pitch is right up their alley.

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy not out 66 (87b 0x4 1x6 127m) SR: 75.86
Hashim Amla b Prasad 55 (58b 5x4 2x6 97m) SR: 94.82

dismissalComment.html: whoa, Prasad has gone right through Hash. Amla was batting on a pristine plane, and looked capable of doing anything. He tried to play this across the line, it wasn't on a full length, and that just made the shot more dangerous. Amla misses for once, and Prasad gets the inward seam to come in and spread-eagle his stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: a wicket out of nowhere. A gift from Smith. Can Sri Lanka make this work for them? Short ball at the body, it was there for the pull, but Smith just played an inch lower than he should have and top-edged it. Easy catch for Tharanga close in on the leg side.

whoa, Prasad has gone right through Hash. Amla was batting on a pristine plane, and looked capable of doing anything. He tried to play this across the line, it wasn't on a full length, and that just made the shot more dangerous. Amla misses for once, and Prasad gets the inward seam to come in and spread-eagle his stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Kallis is gone! Prasad has his third, Kallis had backed away and was looking to go over extra cover, he ended up slicing it to the man on the sweeper cover boundary who judged the tumbling take well

Faf's gone. Malinga is still not done with this game. The yorkers haven't worked today, but the slower balls are. Slow offcutter, stops on Faf who pats it right back after committing to the drive too early. Malinga takes the return catch well.

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers run out (KMDN Kulasekara) 17 (13b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 130.76

dismissalComment.html: AB is gone! Come on South Africa, surely you aren't doing it again! JP dabs a short of length ball behind point and takes off. If there's one batsman who could have completed that run, it was AB. The ball went straight to Nuwan Kula at short third man. Why did they run? Kula arrows down the stumps and that's that for the SA captain.

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c & b Malinga 18 (16b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: Faf's gone. Malinga is still not done with this game. The yorkers haven't worked today, but the slower balls are. Slow offcutter, stops on Faf who pats it right back after committing to the drive too early. Malinga takes the return catch well.

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: The game ends. Dilshan looks to almost be in tears. Sanga has missed a run out. Sri Lanka's biggest names have messed up again, and South Africa are 2-0 up. Short and turning away from Albie, who places the cut well between the two men on either side of point. He didn't time it too well, and the fielder who ran back managed to stop it inside the rope. JP was cramping by the time he turned back for the third but went for it. Sanga had to collect and take the stumps off, but he couldn't collect cleanly. The throw wasn't poor at all. Dilshan is livid. Kirsten and the crew are all smiles.

commentPostTextItems.html: Sri Lanka have positives to take from this game, but that alone won't help unless they begin to turn the results around too. May be that will happen in Bloemfontein. On your way out, do have a read of Abhishek Purohit's match report, and we will soon have more analysis and stories from Firdose Moonda in East London. Until then, on behalf of the crew at ESPNcricinfo, this is Nitin Sundar signing off. Ta!

Duminy is the Man of the Match. "It was great to get a chance at No. 4. We wanted to be more flexible than we usually are. So between myself, AB and Faf we thought we will mix it up a bit and today was my chance. I enjoyed the bowling too, and hope to get 10 overs in sometime. We always knew we'll get there as long as we had wickets, and that's what happened. Just a bit of cramp up there in the end."

AB: "The toss didn't play a big part today. We played good cricket through out and I am very proud. We picked up wickets at crucial times, and Hash the Rock played really well. There would have been more pressure if they had got those 20-25 runs. Hash's wife is yet to give birth, but he will be there for it [and will mostly miss the next game]."

Dilshan: "We were 20-25 short in the batting. First 25 overs we didn't get enough runs. I got run out, this isn't a wicket where you can get run out [Whatever that means!]. At the moment, everything is going wrong for me. Hopefully the next match will be good. Tharanga and Chandimal batted really well, which is a positive sign for us."
"Kepler, please say something to srilankan team to motivate for their 3rd ODI," implores John.

Sri Lanka showed plenty of heart today, especially with the bat, after Dilshan and Sangakkara left them in avoidable strife upfront. But the bowling changes left a lot to be desired, and Malinga didn't have his best day with the ball. South Africa's biggest obstacle in the chase was South Africa, whom they managed to overcome and win with time to spare.
A word of appreciation to JP Duminy, who played the innings of the day. Just what was needed on a slow, stopping pitch, with the bowlers changing the pace all the time.

commentTextItems.html: over-pitched on the stumps, Albie drives it back down the ground and times it pretty well. Long-on saves the boundary, but Albie has two more.
Albie goes down on a knee and tries to dump Dilshan's flighted ball into the grass banks beyong cow corner, but misses. The ball lands outside off and spins away. Nerves!

commentPreTextItems.html: Dilshan comes back on. I am not making this up.

commentTextItems.html: flat ball outside off, Albie mistimes a push off the back foot, and it goes back to Dilshan.
short ball, JP is early on the pull and misses, but it angles away harmlessly.

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: over-pitched outside off, JP absolutely kills the drive, but finds mid-off.
low full tosses have been the order of the day. Here's another one, and Albie drives a single to the left of mid-off.
back of a length, Albie covers the line and plays into the off side.
another effortlessly efficient clip off the pads from Albie and SA have two more.
full length ball on the off stump, JP's taking singles everywhere. This time to long-off.

commentPostTextItems.html: Lasith's bowled out, so Sri Lanka's chances are quite bleak now.

commentTextItems.html: ah well, just as I say that, he's missed a yorker by half a foot. Low full toss in Albie's slot and he whips four crucial runs to deep midwicket.

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: that's probably the best yorker he's bowled today. nearly snaked under Albie's bat as he jammed down on it, but he managed to keep it out. Game not over folks.
very low full toss at 136 kph, that seemed to swing in the air. Albie manages to keep it out, pushing it to mid-off from the crease.

commentPreTextItems.html: Albie comes in. SA are three strokes away from a win. SL five wickets.

commentTextItems.html: Malinga's dropped him first ball! Another full ball that came on slowly, Albie is early on the drive down the ground. It went low to Malinga this time and he couldn't grab, though he got both hands to it.

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c & b Malinga 18 (16b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 112.5

commentTextItems.html: Faf's gone. Malinga is still not done with this game. The yorkers haven't worked today, but the slower balls are. Slow offcutter, stops on Faf who pats it right back after committing to the drive too early. Malinga takes the return catch well.
angled into the pads, Faf tries to nudge with the angle but can't get it away.
another slower ball, JP pushes it to mid-off who comes across quickly to field it.
another slower ball, JP again misses the dab behind square on the off side.
Faf skips out of the crease, and slaps a short ball to the square leg area for a single.
short of a length, that came in a touch as JP tried to dab square. Inside edge, flits away past the stumps.

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c †de Villiers b Tsotsobe 3 (28b 0x4 0x6 36m) SR: 10.71

dismissalComment.html: oh Sanga. Goner. He's been resolute all morning, but inevitably pokes at one outside off. That was on a length, not there for the drive or the cut, and probably had to be left alone. Sanga had left alone too many already, and chose to nibble at it. Thin edge, dies on AB, who takes it in front.

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c †de Villiers b M Morkel 66 (85b 6x4 1x6 125m) SR: 77.64

dismissalComment.html: ah, tragic for SL. Just as he was looking super-ominous, Tharanga is gone. Short of a length and angled across, not too much pace, no sideways movement. Not much room to work with. Tharanga did what he's done efficiently all day - he attempted to make some room and steer with an open-face to third man, but this time he edges it into AB's gloves. Well played, given the circumstances, but he'll hurt on the way back in.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Steyn b M Morkel 19 (26b 1x4 0x6 39m) SR: 73.07

dismissalComment.html: holy cow! Is that a plane? is that Jonty Rhodes? No, that's Dale Steyn! Morne angles a length ball into Mahela's pads, and it is there to be helped along to fine leg. Mahela makes very good connection as he moves inside the line and whip-glances. Steyn is inside the circle at short file leg. He moves to his left, takes off and plucks it when he's nearly fully horizontal, with both hands. Shades of McGrath's catch of Vaughan in Adelaide, many years ago, in the age when Australia used to win the Ashes. Who said fast bowlers can't field. Superb take!

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Peterson b Tsotsobe 22 (13b 2x4 2x6 12m) SR: 169.23

dismissalComment.html: You thought that Steyn catch was a classic? Petersen says hang on, I have some more entertainment. Kula goes back and looks for another straight loft, but doesn't time it that well. Robin is inside the circle at mid-on, and runs back half the way from East London to London proper, looking back over his right shoulder all the time. He then lunges full length forward towards the ropes and the ball tumbles into his palms as he sprawls. South Africa - setting high fielding standards since 1992, only to raise the bar soon after.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c M Morkel b Steyn 28 (29b 1x4 1x6 47m) SR: 96.55

dismissalComment.html: and a wicket to end the innings. Mathews tries to create room and go over mid-off, but the ball stops on him and he toe-ends to Morne at mid-off. Sri Lanka will want the slowness to continue in the chase - this pitch is right up their alley.

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Tharanga b Prasad 28 (56b 2x4 0x6 76m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: a wicket out of nowhere. A gift from Smith. Can Sri Lanka make this work for them? Short ball at the body, it was there for the pull, but Smith just played an inch lower than he should have and top-edged it. Easy catch for Tharanga close in on the leg side.

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Prasad 55 (58b 5x4 2x6 97m) SR: 94.82

dismissalComment.html: whoa, Prasad has gone right through Hash. Amla was batting on a pristine plane, and looked capable of doing anything. He tried to play this across the line, it wasn't on a full length, and that just made the shot more dangerous. Amla misses for once, and Prasad gets the inward seam to come in and spread-eagle his stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c Chandimal b Prasad 37 (51b 3x4 0x6 79m) SR: 72.54

dismissalComment.html: Kallis is gone! Prasad has his third, Kallis had backed away and was looking to go over extra cover, he ended up slicing it to the man on the sweeper cover boundary who judged the tumbling take well

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy not out 66 (87b 0x4 1x6 127m) SR: 75.86

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers run out (KMDN Kulasekara) 17 (13b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 130.76

dismissalComment.html: AB is gone! Come on South Africa, surely you aren't doing it again! JP dabs a short of length ball behind point and takes off. If there's one batsman who could have completed that run, it was AB. The ball went straight to Nuwan Kula at short third man. Why did they run? Kula arrows down the stumps and that's that for the SA captain.

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c & b Malinga 18 (16b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: Faf's gone. Malinga is still not done with this game. The yorkers haven't worked today, but the slower balls are. Slow offcutter, stops on Faf who pats it right back after committing to the drive too early. Malinga takes the return catch well.

headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Albie Morkel not out 12 (11b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 109.09
